Superelevation is the banking of a roadway at a curve, where the outer edge of the road is elevated higher than the inner edge. This design helps counteract the lateral acceleration experienced by vehicles, improving safety and comfort by reducing the tendency of vehicles to skid outward. Superelevation is commonly used on highways, railways, and other high-speed roadways to allow for smoother and safer turns.

How Do I Negotiate S Lanes? Today, I want to shed light on an innovative solution that's transforming our roads and enhancing traffic flow: S-lanes. üåü S-lanes are a game-changer in urban planning and traffic management. By creating a designated right-turn lane through a clever S-shaped configuration, these lanes not only optimise traffic but also prioritise safety. The key? A single unbroken white line that separates these lanes, serving as a clear boundary to ensure smooth merging without confusion. As professionals invested in shaping a better future, it's inspiring to witness such intelligent solutions in action.
